gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Data depicts the locations of three historic canals in Indiana, the Wabash-Erie Canal, White Water Canal and the Central Canal. These canals were constructed and used for transportation between 1830-1870. Canal historians have searched county courthouse records and archived state engineering reports to plot canal routes on USGS 7.5 minute quadrangles. Some portions of the canal routes are unknown and approximated as indicated in the table. In many locations canals have been filled in and covered by development. is collected only from southern Indiana border through Vigo and Marion counties.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This data was collected by Bernardin-Lochmueller and Associates, IN; to depict the locations of canals in Indiana. Canal locations indicate the possibility historic structures.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: DATA DISCLAIMER This data set was compiled by Bernardin, Lochmueller and Associates, using data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the designed format or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from this data. CREDIT Please acknowledge Stan Schmitt.

MAP DISCLAIMER: This map was compiled by Bernardin-Lochmueller & Associates, Inc. using data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all maps. This product is distributed "as is" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. Users must assume responsibility to determine the appropriate use of the data. No attempt has been made in either the design or production of these maps to define the limits or jurisdicition of any federal, state, or local government. These maps are intended for use only at the published scale. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis may differ from this map. Land ownership changes continually, so additional lands or changes in ownership beyond the data currentness will not be reflected on this map. LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY: The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Bernardin-Lochmueller & Associates shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data, or other comercial or economic loss. Bernardin-Lochmueller & Assoicates are not responsible for claims made by a third party.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: All lines are snapped and entered correctly.

All finished, connected canal routes within the study area of Indiana are mapped. Many sections were destroyed and covered by development. South of the Central Canal, there are six disjunct canal sections that were planned to be connected. These sections are not mapped.
Deductive Estimate: Accuracy is estimated to be good. Quality is dependant on historian knowledge and availabiliy of historic records.

The collector of the data descriptions estimated the error at approximately 100 feet. Users should expect error between 50-300 feet at various locations. Tables indicate sections of routes that are unknown and estimated.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Stan Schmitt plotted historic canal routes on USGS quads by researching archived historic records. Schmitt's USGS routes were traced onto company USGS quads to create route maps. Company route maps were digitized onscreen into ArcView GIS using DRGs of quads and visual landmarks. No paper was scanned or registered.

The original shapefile CANALS_HISTORIC_ROUTES_SW was used and then additional digitization work was done by using Stan Schmitt's USGS routes were traced onto company USGS quads to create route maps. Company route maps were digitized onscreen into ArcView GIS using DRGs of quads and visual landmarks. No paper was scanned or registered. This file was then saved as Canals_Historic_Routes_IN

A shapefile named "CANALS" was obtained by the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) from Bernardin, Lochmueller, & Assoc. Inc. Personnel of IGS clipped the shapefile to a coverage named "SWCLP83," which contains the area within the boundaries of the southwestern 26 counties in the state of Indiana, compiled at a scale of 1:24,000. The Geoprocessing Wizard in ArcView was used to perform the clipping operation. The clipped shapefile was renamed "CANALS_HISTORIC_ROUTES_SW."

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.
Canal routes penciled on USGS quads were digitized onscreen into ArcView GIS using visual landmarks. This is the only information source of this detail known to exist in a map format.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: Stan Schmitt has worked as a Indiana canal historian for over 20 years and is an active member of the Indiana Canal Society.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
